00017 =head1 NAME
00018 
00019 contextLimitedPoint.pl - Allow point entry but no point operations.
00020 
00021 =head1 DESCRIPTION
00022 
00023 Implements a context in which points can be entered,
00024 but no operations are permitted between points.  So
00025 students will be able to perform operations within the
00026 coordinates of the points, but not between points.
00027 
00028     Context("LimitedPoint")
00029 
00030 =cut
00031 
00032 loadMacros("MathObjects.pl");
00033 
00034 sub _contextLimitedPoint_init {LimitedPoint::Init()}; # don't load it again
00035 
00036 ##################################################
00037 #
00038 #  Handle common checking for BOPs
00039 #
00040 package LimitedPoint::BOP;
00041 
00042 #
00043 #  Do original check and then if the operands are numbers, its OK.
00044 #  Otherwise report an error.
00045 #
00046 sub _check {
00047   my $self = shift;
00048   my $super = ref($self); $super =~ s/LimitedPoint/Parser/;
00049   &{$super."::_check"}($self);
00050   return if $self->checkNumbers;
00051   my $bop = $self->{def}{string} || $self->{bop};
00052   $self->Error("In this context, '%s' can only be used with Numbers",$bop);
00053 }
00054 
00055 ##############################################
00056 #
00057 #  Now we get the individual replacements for the operators
00058 #  that we don't want to allow.  We inherit everything from
00059 #  the original Parser::BOP class, except the _check
00060 #  routine, which comes from LimitedPoint::BOP above.
00061 #
00062 
00063 package LimitedPoint::BOP::add;
00064 our @ISA = qw(LimitedPoint::BOP Parser::BOP::add);
00065 
00066 ##############################################
00067 
00068 package LimitedPoint::BOP::subtract;
00069 our @ISA = qw(LimitedPoint::BOP Parser::BOP::subtract);
00070 
00071 ##############################################
00072 
00073 package LimitedPoint::BOP::multiply;
00074 our @ISA = qw(LimitedPoint::BOP Parser::BOP::multiply);
00075 
00076 ##############################################
00077 
00078 package LimitedPoint::BOP::divide;
00079 our @ISA = qw(LimitedPoint::BOP Parser::BOP::divide);
00080 
00081 ##############################################
00082 ##############################################
00083 #
00084 #  Now we do the same for the unary operators
00085 #
00086 
00087 package LimitedPoint::UOP;
00088 
00089 sub _check {
00090   my $self = shift;
00091   my $super = ref($self); $super =~ s/LimitedPoint/Parser/;
00092   &{$super."::_check"}($self);
00093   return if $self->checkNumber;
00094   my $uop = $self->{def}{string} || $self->{uop};
00095   $self->Error("In this context, '%s' can only be used with Numbers",$uop);
00096 }
00097 
00098 ##############################################
00099 
00100 package LimitedPoint::UOP::plus;
00101 our @ISA = qw(LimitedPoint::UOP Parser::UOP::plus);
00102 
00103 ##############################################
00104 
00105 package LimitedPoint::UOP::minus;
00106 our @ISA = qw(LimitedPoint::UOP Parser::UOP::minus);
00107 
00108 ##############################################
00109 ##############################################
00110 #
00111 #  Absolute value does vector norm, so we
00112 #  trap that as well.
00113 #
00114 
00115 package LimitedPoint::List::AbsoluteValue;
00116 our @ISA = qw(Parser::List::AbsoluteValue);
00117 
00118 sub _check {
00119   my $self = shift;
00120   $self->SUPER::_check;
00121   return if $self->{coords}[0]->type eq 'Number';
00122   $self->Error("Vector norm is not allowed in this context");
00123 }
00124 
00125 ##############################################
00126 ##############################################
00127 
00128 package LimitedPoint;
00129 
00130 sub Init {
00131   #
00132   #  Build the new context that calls the
00133   #  above classes rather than the usual ones
00134   #
00135 
00136   my $context = $main::context{LimitedPoint} = Parser::Context->getCopy("Point");
00137   $context->{name} = "LimitedPoint";
00138   $context->operators->set(
00139     '+' => {class => 'LimitedPoint::BOP::add'},
00140     '-' => {class => 'LimitedPoint::BOP::subtract'},
00141     '*' => {class => 'LimitedPoint::BOP::multiply'},
00142    '* ' => {class => 'LimitedPoint::BOP::multiply'},
00143    ' *' => {class => 'LimitedPoint::BOP::multiply'},
00144     ' ' => {class => 'LimitedPoint::BOP::multiply'},
00145     '/' => {class => 'LimitedPoint::BOP::divide'},
00146    ' /' => {class => 'LimitedPoint::BOP::divide'},
00147    '/ ' => {class => 'LimitedPoint::BOP::divide'},
00148    'u+' => {class => 'LimitedPoint::UOP::plus'},
00149    'u-' => {class => 'LimitedPoint::UOP::minus'},
00150  );
00151   #
00152   #  Remove these operators and functions
00153   #
00154   $context->operators->undefine('_','U','><','.');
00155   $context->functions->undefine('norm','unit');
00156   $context->lists->set(
00157     AbsoluteValue => {class => 'LimitedPoint::List::AbsoluteValue'},
00158   );
00159   $context->parens->set(
00160     '(' => {formMatrix => 0},
00161     '[' => {formMatrix => 0},
00162   );
00163   $context->variables->are(x=>'Real');
00164 
00165   main::Context("LimitedPoint");  ### FIXME:  probably should require author to set this explicitly
00166 }
00167 
00168 1;
